intro: Acinodendron brachyantherum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
